tweets.text: On duty today as the area Flood Operation duty officer, our teams are out across the area @EnvAgencyMids We have Barriers erected and being looked after 24/7 at #Hereford #Shrewsbury #Bewdley we are also checking and clearing  #trashscreens (All other barriers loaded and ready ) https://t.co/awkpt6VlwM

A busy night for the emergency services in Cornwall. 18 people evacuated from caravans at Notter Bridge & some residents asked to leave homes in Lostwithiel as a precaution. @CornwallFRS @MCA_media @EnvAgency @DC_Police https://t.co/ggv0oaQNUB

@VerValleySoc @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I hope it's been sorted, it was in the paper. It's just the complete lack of thought. They dug a collection/settling pool that helps clear most of the runoff but this one drain went straight to the then - empty 'ditch' üôÑ
@lilrobbergirl @Feargal_Sharkey That's shocking. And the work not executed with care either. Surely one for the @EnvAgency...

Heavy rain brings a high risk of surface water #flooding.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority.

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/HDxT25SFg1

Our community support officers are out & about in #Hereford giving #flood advice to members of the public

Keep up to date with the latest #flood warnings

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/BKIMNbLMJP

tweets.text: @VerValleySoc @Feargal_Sharkey üò† Here's the storm drain for the new estate plumbed directly into the winterbourne at the source of the wey, and the clean water joining it from a lower spring https://t.co/ytitWTtNSb
@TheProspect1 @ExeterCouncil We don‚Äôt expect the river to reach a level where the Exeter Quay defences are needed, but we are monitoring the situation very closely.

2/2 -These are all typical winter operations After a rainfall event.  You will see our field teams out and about all weekend checking our flood assets and clearing debris screens. https://t.co/rVIbB2ANOM

Are we #PlanningtoFlood?  Can we really afford to develop in areas with evident flooding problems?  How is the current planning consultation going to manage this problem? Imagine how frightening the rain yesterday must have been for the people living next to this. @NatFloodForum https://t.co/wvbrPeBdjv

1/2 - In the last 24 hours widespread rain has fallen on Somerset's already wet catchments. Spillways are running and pumps will be switched on as river levels allow. We are using the Sowy flood relief channel to help mange flows in the Parrett and Tone.

A heavy shower this morning set off a whole chain of hidden #RiverVer storm drains that dump polluted road runoff into our #chalkstream. It's time this issue was taken more seriously. https://t.co/mdnB019qix
@GarethSimkins @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency EA FOI total joke never provide the information requested & always Redacted(cover up ?) https://t.co/x4o7QNVdY3

Friday was a very wet day for parts of the country, but especially so across the higher ground of #Wales and southwest #England

@AnaGuerreroPT @EnvAgency @ViridorUK https://t.co/wfaz0CUm8x

Exciting news! We've been awarded ¬£42K from @EnvAgencyYNE Riparian Tree Planting fund! 2.33km of new native hedge along Snape Clough, Meltham (14,000 hedge plants). Thanks Yorkshire EA team for their support! Partnering with  @treesponsibilit & @aireriverstrust #trees üå≥üå≥ https://t.co/IlzMeYJSnT
@WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency Redacted as commercially sensitive data, I imagine. Smells suss, though.

Bulgaria is accused of burning waste illegally in coal fired power stations. Bulgaria has no EfW facilities never mind R1 rated facilities. I asked via FOI where this waste went. I received this. @EnvAgency you will not stop the illegal export of waste by helping to cover it up. https://t.co/fDvMhlhHsj https://t.co/RswygwDEqh

tweets.text: Building leaky dams in this weeks heavy rain, strong winds & clarty ground conditions was tricky. This almost completed dam is 17m wide. Our 3d model estimates it will store 800 cubic m. A landscape scale #nfm project above Staveley for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW #LakeDistrict https://t.co/Bau0O1hlWn

tweets.text:
We're also out in #Hereford and #Bewdley talking to communities about #Flood risk.

Check if your home or workplace is at risk of flooding at https://t.co/Yu9SYkYtrI https://t.co/SM2patZ8AX

#TeamEA is out clearing grids on rivers across the #Northwest today ahead of rain that is expected this weekend üå®Ô∏è

Our teams will be out across the weekend making sure our rivers are free of debris. https://t.co/7uyKjRkjFG

UK Weather - Surface flooding at Moreton-on-Lugg in Herefordshire today - the River Lugg and Wye are on flood alert - Editors more images at Alamy Live News REF 2DNXJ79 @AlamyNews #riverlugg #lugg #river @guardianphotos @TimesPictures @TelegraphPics #herefordshire @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/IqTCBpfBrf

tweets.text: @BristolCouncil @EnvAgency I‚Äôm very keen that the City looks to use natural ways to manage floodwater rather than extensive concrete channels and culverts where  possible. Using elevated concrete walkways to provide resilience and safe egress during a flood event proposed by some are wrong in my view.

Did you know Bristol has a history of flooding, including 20 tidal floods in the last decade alone? 
We‚Äôve worked with @envagency to develop new proposals to manage Bristol‚Äôs flood risk in the future. 
Tell us what you think before 20 December (tomorrow!)
https://t.co/XXgKiXx88f

tweets.text:
Across the #northwest there are currently;  
‚û°Ô∏è9 flood alerts and 
‚û°Ô∏è1 flood warning in place. 

Visit https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn for the latest. 

#prepareactsurvive #floodalert #floodwarning #bepreparef
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency Can you put this in perspective. What was the peak earlier this year that led to the most extensive flooding?
Incredible work by your teams Drew @HMCoastguard with @CornwallFRS, @DCfieldteamsEA @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/gocVYzZfok

So, a story of tweets. 

Last night, in preparedness for flooding events, the SAR Cell was set up at @DC_Police HQ. 

I also tasked @PrawlePointCG & BigburyCG to complete logistics, recce‚Äôs and minor rescues across Devon between Plymouth and Exeter. They were out for 10hrs.

River Wye in Hereford City is very high & rising.

A peak of 4.5-5.0m is expected late today.

Riverside paths & parks will be affected but major flooding not now expected. https://t.co/irotcJo66O
@anotherJon @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW Thanks Jon!
@catchmentdesign @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW Nice work! Thank you.

@xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW Great to see it Will. I still check the https://t.co/Sc2nIT3L7G river and sea level sites and miss being out there with the teams. Stay safe, get that data and protect the public. Merry Xmas
